subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: A South Korean boxer who lost consciousness after winning a championship bout last week has been declared brain dead, said Ko Seung-kwan, a spokesman at Asan Medical Center in Seoul. The boxer, Choi Yo-Sam, 33, was found to be brain dead in a preliminary test conducted at Soon Chun Hyang hospital in Seoul before he was transferred on Monday to Asan Medical Center. He fell unconscious after successfully defending his World Boxing Organization intercontinental flyweight title on Dec. 25.He collapsed five seconds before the end of the 12th and final round after the challenger Heri Amol of Indonesia threw a right to his jaw. Choi managed to stand as he was declared the winner but fell into a coma immediately afterward.
